review_title: Retention Issues bc of Underpayment and Wage Stagnation
job_title: Assistant Professor in Forest Lake, IL
pros: The students are terrific here: kind and very respectful for the most part and interested in learning.
cons: Faculty are grossly underpaid here. There is little room for growth, and salaries remain depressed as a result of a privileged few who have access to generational wealth and are therefore unlikely to demand a livable wage. Other faculty without such financial privileges—e.g., those who are primary or only bread-winners for their households—live paycheck-to-paycheck. Retirement benefits were recently cut from 10% to 8% without warning. If you are a person of color or a queer person, you will find that the institution has a history of substituting many toothless “conversations” for actual change (e.g., in policies, procedures, reporting processes, etc.). Participation in such conversations has yielded little to nothing, and those most affected, offended, and otherwise disadvantaged by events of bias may find these endless talks without real accountability draining. The facilities of this campus are in need of much attention and urgently so. The dorms have not been kept up—leaks, vermin, lack of heating have all been reported by students repeatedly for the last 6+ years with no movement on the issue. The endowment is in a depleted condition. If you expect or need to have upward mobility as far as your salary is concerned, you may wish to have frank conversations about your financial needs (and what you deserve!) before accepting any offer.
